intro: Spermacoce serpyllifolia, commonly known as mouse-ear or field spermacoce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually small and rounded. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Spermacoce serpyllifolia is often found in temperate regions and is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
